data.title: Only Salon: Expanding Abstraction
data.meta_description: Join Carter Foster, Deputy Director for Curatorial Affairs and Curator of Prints and Drawings for an introduction to Expanding Abstraction:
data.text:
Join Carter Foster, Deputy Director for Curatorial Affairs and Curator of Prints and Drawings for an introduction to Expanding Abstraction: Pushing the Boundaries of Painting in the Americas, 1958-1983. Enjoy an artful conversation exploring how painting has transformed, starting with abstraction in the early 20th century, the rise of Abstract Expressionism in the late 1940s and 1950s, and through the experimental paintings of the 1960s and 1970s. A link to register will be emailed to all Blanton members. Not a member? Learn how to join here!

[button link=’https://54061.blackbaudhosting.com/54061/Member-Art-Salon-Expanding-Abstraction’ label=’CLICK HERE TO REGISTER’]

Feature image credit: Alice Baber, ’Lavender High,’ 1968, Oil on canvas, 75 1/2 x 75 1/2 inches, Michener Acquisition Fund, Blanton Museum of Art, The University of Texas at Austin
